required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Plasma Ropivacaine Concentrations After Sciatic Nerve Block in Patients With Chronic Kidney Disease
clinical_study.official_title: Plasma Ropivacaine Concentrations After Peripheral Nerve Block in Patients With Severe Renal Dysfunction

brief_summary.textblock:
This prospective observational study aimed to examine the pharmacokinetics of ropivacaine in patients with chronic kidney disease after sciatic nerve block.
Sciatic nerve block for foot and ankle surgery will be performed using ropivacaine under ultrasound-guidance, and arterial blood test will be taken for total plasma ropivacaine concentration at 2.5, 5, 15, 30, 60 minutes and 2, 6, 24 hours after sciatic nerve block.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 2.5, 5, 15, 30, 60 minutes and 2, 6, 24 hours after sciatic nerve block
primary_outcome.description: whether the unbound plasma concentration of ropivacaine was maintained under 0.56 mcg/ml that was determined as toxic level in a previous study.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2.5, 5, 15, 30, 60 minutes and 2, 6, 24 hours after sciatic nerve block
2.5, 5, 15, 30, 60 minutes and 2, 6, 24 hours after sciatic nerve block

secondary_outcome.description: 11-point numeric rating scale ranging from '0' representing one extreme (e.g. "extremely dissatisfied") to '10' representing the other extreme (e.g. "extremely satisfied")
numbness of the tongue, twitching, convulsion, dysarrhythmia, coma

arm_group.description: Patients scheduled for foot and ankle surgery under sciatic nerve block and who had chronic kidney disease

intervention.description: Sciatic nerve block will be performed using ropivacaine (2.5mg/kg) under ultrasound-guidance with nerve stimulator.

biospec_descr.textblock: Arterial blood sampling will be taken at 2.5, 5, 15, 30, 60 minutes and 2, 6, 24 hours after sciatic nerve block.

study_pop.textblock: Patients scheduled for foot and ankle surgery under sciatic nerve block and who had chronic kidney disease

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients scheduled for foot and ankle surgery
- Patients with chronic kidney disease (glomerular filtration rate < 60 ml/min/1.73m2) (changed from 30 ml/min/1.73m2 to facilitate patient recruitment)
- Patients who are thought to be clinically helpful to receive sciatic nerve block rather than general anesthesia because of comorbidities such as cardiopulmonary dysfunction and cerebral dysfunction
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who need to renal replacement therapy, such as hemodialysis
- Patients with liver disease (aspartate transaminase OR alanine transaminase > 80 IU/L)
- Patients with allergic disease
- Patients with previous history of drug allery
- Patients with chronic pain persisting 3 months

condition_browse.mesh_term: Drug-Related Side Effects and Adverse Reactions
